title: Dave's Low Country Boil Recipe
description: Low country boil is a famously flavorful one-pot feast of seafood, sausage, potatoes, and corn. It's an outdoor cooking classic, but fun indoors too.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE U.S. Recipes Southern Main Dishes Seafood Dave's Low Country Boil 4.8 (557) 424 Reviews 112 Photos Low country boil is famous in Georgia and South Carolina. This boil is done best on an outdoor cooker. It has sausage, shrimp, crab, potatoes, and corn for an all-in-one-pot, all-you-can-eat buffet! Grab a paper plate and a beer and enjoy! Submitted by Lisa Updated on December 19, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 112 112 112 112 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 15 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This Low Country boil recipe is fun, flavorful, and the perfect way to feed a crowd.  What Is a Low Country Boil?  A Low Country boil (a.k.a. Frogmore Stew) is a seafood boil that's associated with South Carolina. The dish is a seasoned medley of boiled corn, shrimp, sausage, and potatoes. It’s traditionally drained, then served on a newspaper-covered table.  How to Cook Low Country Boil You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: What Is In Low Country Boil?  This Low Country boil recipe consists of new potatoes, cooked kielbasa (cut into 1-inch pieces), fresh corn, whole crab (broken into pieces), and fresh shrimp (peeled and deveined) seasoned with seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay) — if you don’t have the store-bought stuff, you can make your own spice blend at home.  How to Make Low Country Boil Here’s a brief overview of what you can expect when you host a Low Country boil at home:  Heat water over an outdoor cooker or on the stovetop. Season and bring to a boil. Add potatoes and sausage and cook for 10 minutes. Break corn ears in half, then add the corn and crab and cook for another 5 minutes.Add shrimp when potatoes are almost tender. Cook until they are just cooked through.Drain, then pour the contents out onto a picnic table covered with newspaper. What to Serve With Low Country Boil Because Low Country boil is a meal in and of itself, there’s no need to pair it with any sides. If you’d like to go the extra mile, though, explore our collection of Southern Side Dishes. Here are a few of the top-rated recipes you’ll find:  Southern Coleslaw Grandmother’s Buttermilk Cornbread Kickin’ Collard Greens Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise  “Delicious,” raves Carol Thieme Watson. “I made this for a group of us camping. Everyone loved it! I The only alteration I made was I added mussels.” “This recipe was great,” says Classie Norfleet. “I added a bay leaf and lemons to the boiling water. My family loved this recipe.” Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 15 servings 1 tablespoon seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay), or to taste 5 pounds new potatoes 3 (16 ounce) packages cooked kielbasa sausage, cut into 1 inch pieces 8 ears fresh corn, husks and silks removed 5 pounds whole crab, broken into pieces 4 pounds fresh shrimp, peeled and deveined Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat a large pot of water over an outdoor cooker, or on the stovetop over medium-high heat. Add seafood seasoning to taste and bring to a boil. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add potatoes and sausage and cook for 10 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Break corn ears in half; add corn and crab and cook for another 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add shrimp when potatoes are almost tender and everything else is almost done; cook until shrimp are just cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes longer. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Drain off and discard the water. Pour the contents out onto a picnic table covered with newspaper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 1,370 home cooks made it! If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Dave's Low Country Boil 01 of 112 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 112 Photo by  Sonya A 01/01/2025 This was a great base starter recipe. I agree with others that you need way more seasoning then the recipe calls for. We do this every New Year's Eve! 03 of 112 Photo by  MirthTart2052 03/06/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser So the recipe was absolutely amazing and instead of sausage I just used snow crab and large peeled tail on shrimp and it was awesome!!! 04 of 112 Photo by  Papa Don 05/10/2021 05 of 112 Photo by  Aikesha Tucker 04/03/2021 06 of 112 Photo by  TiTi Bug 02/07/2021 07 of 112 Photo by  TiTi Bug 02/07/2021 08 of 112 Photo by  TiTi Bug 02/07/2021 09 of 112 Photo by  Mou's Recipe Box 10/17/2020 Outstanding! Perfection in a pot! My very first seafood boil!!! I loved the other tips from other reviews...especially from Eggelston (hope I spelled that right). We loved this....new family tradition has been established! 10 of 112 Photo by  eponymous74 08/26/2020 This turned out perfectly the first time we made it. We made this for Mother’s Day, and it exceeded my expectations. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Fab Summer Blackened Chicken Salad 25 Ratings Maui Wowie Shrimp 66 Ratings Firecracker Grilled Alaska Salmon 1,353 Ratings Key West Chicken 1,574 Ratings Fish Tacos Ultimo 227 Ratings Tex-Mex Burger with Cajun Mayo 467 Ratings Louisiana Crawfish Boil 26 Ratings Hawaiian Chicken Pineapple Kabobs 798 Ratings Yeah, I-Lived-in-Texas, Smoked Brisket 39 Ratings Grilled Wonton Chicken Salad 31 Ratings Chris' Bay Area Burger 905 Ratings Spicy Grilled Shrimp 1,154 Ratings New York Strip Chicago Style 64 Ratings Fried Soft-Shell Crab 41 Ratings Cornell Chicken 85 Ratings Fire and Ice Smoked Salmon 13 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
